result.execSummary:
The defendant Damien D Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT: Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 03-30-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Concurrent with: with 25 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence. Huber Privileges.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT to any other sentence. Huber Privileges.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 25 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence. Huber Privileges.

As to count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONCURRENT to any other sentence. Huber Privileges.


Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 03-30-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 
Appeal rights given by the court

Filed:

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Damien D Brown not in court, in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for sentencing, however Branch 31 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Damien D Brown not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Court is in trial. Case adjourned to Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department until next court appearance.

ADDRESS INFO for Damien D Brown
Current: 2739 N 33rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 09-09-2016)
Prior: 3334 W. Highland Blvd APT 805, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Damien D Brown in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  At the hour of 2:53 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO BOTH COUNTS which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Case passed.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel made record about video he received yesterday.  Trial proceeded.  Back on the stand for continued cross examination:  Officer Mark Dillman - MPD.  Exhibits 13 and 14 offered and received.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 9:36 am.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court had  colloquy with the defendant about his right to testify/not testify.  Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Defense calls no witnesses.  Jury instruction conference held.  Jury in the box at 9:58 am.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:52 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Myer who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury in box at 11:45 am to address juror question.  Jury released for lunch.  Case adjourned until 1:30 pm.
- filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions
Jury Questions

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury panel in court at 1:54 pm.  Jury sworn at 1:56 pm.  Opening statements by state.  Defense reserves right to opening statement.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Joseph H., Officer Jose Rivera - MPD. Exhibit  2-4 received.  Jury out at 2:43 pm.  Jury in box at 3:05 pm.  Sworn for the State:  Officer Mark Dillman - MPD.  Exhibit 5-9 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 3:35 pm.  Discussions held regarding DVD.  Juryin box at 3:55 pm.  Back on the stand for continued cross examination:  Officer Mark Dillman - MPD.  Defense reserves the right to recall Officer Dillman.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Chad Boyack - MPD.  Jury released at 4:10 pm.  Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 21.  Jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Motions in limine.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:18 am.  Twelve (12) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Case adjourned until 1:30 pm.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Daniel Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel has a dental emergency and requested an adjourment; no objection from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The Court was ready to proceed with this trial today.  Court grants defense motion to adjourn so that newly mentioned witnesses can be located and matter can be investigated further.  Court ordered defense to turn over witness list once the witnesses are identified.  Earlier dates were offered to defense but defense calendar didn't allow.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on August 31, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Court ordered the defendant to possess no weapons.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests time to review discovery.  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damien D Brown in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Damien D Brown in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.    Defendant is advised this case is re-assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24 DUE TO CO-DEFENDANT HAVING lower number case(s) pending.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
